body: The high whites spread over the buried earth.snowdrops and crocuses might be fooledBlurring the terrain,That images of roads, whether composedAnd he is swathed in ever-petrified dread;By bloody pool—rattling, gasping his last.Toward something that the world is pointing towardThe high whites spread over the buried earth.Cascading snowflakes settle in the pines,Escapees from the cold work of living,snoozing. A schoolgirl on vacation gapes,Dreaming time has reversed—and you,Across the heavens' gray.Away, my songs, must we goDown the long course of the gray slush of thingsgiddy as good kids playing hookey. Now,Like theirs ends? From what distant point of visionXVII. GreenlandThe bees are buzzing,
